text: Alexander Simpson Hutchinson Forsyth (29 September 1928 – 30 March 2020) was a Scottish footballer who played in the Scottish Football League for Albion Rovers and East Stirlingshire and in the English Football League for Darlington in the 1950s. He also played junior football for Linlithgow Rose. After retiring as a player because of injury, he went on to work as chief scout for East Stirlingshire, and later became a director of the club. Forsyth died on 30 March 2020.Obituary – Alex Forsyth ==Notes== ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Footballers from Glasgow Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football wingers Category:Linlithgow Rose F.C. players Category:Albion Rovers F.C. players Category:Darlington F.C. players Category:East Stirlingshire F.C. players Category:Scottish Junior Football Association players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:English Football League players Category:People from Baillieston
title: Alex Forsyth (footballer, born 1928)
